text: I'm having a really bizarre problem with packages on 1.6-beta... I have a package I want to update the version of, but it's just not updating.  When I look in the general registry, the version I want in there, but when I look in the version of the general registry it installed on my machine, it's not there, any idea what's going on?

elements.text: I'm having a really bizarre problem with packages on 1.6-beta... I have a package I want to update the version of, but it's just not updating.  When I look in the general registry, the version I want in there, but when I look in the version of the general registry it installed on my machine, it's not there, any idea what's going on?

text: and the package I want to upgrade has `julia = "1"` in the compat

text: I tried deleting my registries, the refreshed registry has the same problem

elements.text: I tried deleting my registries, the refreshed registry has the same problem

text: I tried deleting `.julia`, same problem
this is totally bizarre... I fixed it by deleting the registry and manually cloning from github... somehow the registry that Julia was cloning for me was out of date and wouldn't update

elements.text: this is totally bizarre... I fixed it by deleting the registry and manually cloning from github... somehow the registry that Julia was cloning for me was out of date and wouldn't update

text: are you using Pkg Server or github directly?

elements.text: are you using Pkg Server or github directly?

text: I *CAN* reproduce this... if I delete the registry again and let Julia clone it for me, it gives me the older registry

elements.text: reproduce this... if I delete the registry again and let Julia clone it for me, it gives me the older registry

text: try with `JULIA_PKG_SERVER=""`
I thought I tried both... how do I turn of pkg server again?

elements.text: I thought I tried both... how do I turn of pkg server again?

text: yeah I treid that... oh wait, do I have to do it from the shell?

elements.text: yeah I treid that... oh wait, do I have to do it from the shell?

text: you can either do `JULIA_PKG_SERVER="" julia`
or set `Env["JULIA_PKG_SERVER"] = ""`
yeah that did not work... let me try again

elements.text: yeah that did not work... let me try again

text: Should one do this even if one is not experiencing issues?

elements.text: Should one do this even if one is not experiencing issues?

text: no
ah! no, it's Pkg server, something is wrong. Also the reason I didn't notice before was because it doesn't always seem to use git unless I set the env var before starting julia

elements.text: ah! no, it's Pkg server, something is wrong. Also the reason I didn't notice before was because it doesn't always seem to use git unless I set the env var before starting julia

text: if you permanently want to use git, export it in your .bashrc or equivalent
